website_summaries.verdict: A knife of excellent quality that is ideal for carving larger meats.
pros: Very sharp 12-inch blade makes it easy to carve even slices
Granton blade creates pockets of air to prevent food from sticking to the blade
Less friction makes it easy to use
cons: Not ideal for cutting smaller meats due to its length

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic. I saw this knife on Cook's Country - ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. I saw this knife on Cook's Country - winning their testing as the best of 8 knives. On Cook's Country it was said to be $55, but Amazon had a much better price. I bought one for myself; and when I saw how easily it cut through meat I ordered one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: SE1964

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about about 6 months ago to slice my briskets. It's razor sharp and when used properly can cut a brisket to look like you used a mechanical meat slicer. Love it. Be careful because the rounded front end is also razor sharp:)
customer_reviews.author: Noel R. Gould

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this knife!!
customer_reviews.text: I make my own bacon and was looking at slicers and decided on this slicing knife, so glad I did! Once you go up past a 7 inch blade the prices jump quite a bit and the pork bellies are about 10 inches and I like full cuts. They also can tear up the pork belly. This is a Hempler center cut bacon slab which is much denser than the pork belly after smoking and it cut through this like butter! Tried some tomatoes and other items and I’m so glad I went this route! So bacon buddies out there this is a great knife for slicing up your pork bellies!!!
customer_reviews.author: Queen Tyrant Ruler

customer_reviews.title: I highly suggesting finding one here on amazon to keep the blade in good shape if you are going to be storing this ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sharp knife that carves a roast very well. I recently used it to slice prime rib and the cuts were smooth and consistent. My only complaint is that the knife doesn't come with any sort of sheath or blade guard. I highly suggesting finding one here on amazon to keep the blade in good shape if you are going to be storing this knife in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Buy what the pros buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Victorinox professionally and personally for many year. They do not disappoint. This specific model is heavier than past V slicers I have had. It seems to add a lot of stability when cutting strip loins with fat caps. I never miss an opportunity to tell people not to buy expensive "heirloom" knives but rather buy what the pros buy. This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Don K

customer_reviews.title: Great knife but long enough that storage options are somewhat limited
customer_reviews.text: The knife arrived quite sharp, ready to use. The blade has stayed sharp after a moderate amount of use. The knife feels well made. I'd give it 5 starts except that it's long enough that it's hard to find a safe place to store it. The knife blocks I've tried are not long enough. The Victorinox plastic knife guards don't come in a size long enough to cover the blade.
customer_reviews.author: William Renfroe

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the price. Very sharp and does what it is supposed to. Clean smooth consistent cuts. Doesn’t tear the meat and makes for beautiful cuts for presentation. Overall durability and ability to hold an edge is yet to be seen but at this price, I can afford to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent slicer
customer_reviews.text: If you're slicing your holiday prime rib roast or turkey, this tool is indispensable. It's extremely sharp and easy to hold. The blade design reduces drag while slicing and easily passes through the largest prime rib. The handle is of good shape and easy to grip, even when your hands are wet or greasy. I've used this on prime rib, brisket, baby back ribs, turkey, chicken, and ham. It's an excellent all-around slicer and a must-have for those larger cuts of meat. Pros: - Very sharp - Easy to hold Cons: - None
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Geek

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp!
customer_reviews.text: So sharp! Slides through brisket like butter! Cleans up beautifully, no stains on the stainless. My husband loves this knife and finds reasons to use it. I took off one star because it does not come with a sheath for storage, and it’s too long for a knife block, so storage is a bit precarious. It’s not a knife you want floating around unsheathed in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: PageDR6

customer_reviews.title: The Hype Is Real
customer_reviews.text: This knife is the real deal! I purchased for cutting both raw and thicker cooked meats such as tritip. This cuts through meat like it is butter. It does struggle with thinner cuts of meat as flank steak.....but this is the wrong knife you that type of cut anyway. HIGHLY recommend this knife for brisket, tritip, turkey, prime rib, roast and any other thick cuts. Pros: * Works as advertised, great meat knife. * Cleans easily * S-H-A-R-P ...watch your fingers Cons: * Doesn't come with sheath * Not as effective on thinner cuts of meat (as expected)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Dirkstein

customer_reviews.title: Great for slicing bacon.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this knife to primarily slice homemade bacon. Have also used on larger cuts like brisket and even used it to cut watermelon. The thin blade is extremely sharp and makes slicing simple which gives nice even cuts. Would definitely to anyone looking for a great slicing knife. The length can make storing an issue so it would be nice if it came with a case. Overall very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Reed Nystrom

customer_reviews.title: One of four knives I use
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic slicing knife! Haven't had to sharpen it in four years and it has never failed to do the job of slicing, whether a roast, a ham or a bacon covered meatloaf. In my kitchen, I have four knives -- three Wustoff: a paring knife, boning knife and chef's knife; and this Victorinox. Despite spending what I did on the other three, this is a heck of a knife for the price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Quality costs...
customer_reviews.text: Sliced paper right out of the clam shell package. Haven't touched it with a steel yet. Bought specifically to slice brisket. TBD.... How it holds an edge. Impressive to begin with. Update: after it's 1st use slicing a brisket,it still had its razor sharp edge. Of course it will need the steel as a maintenance but this proved the quality of the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Ginzo1

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a knife, but better!
customer_reviews.text: I waited to buy one of these, not sure why. I have a set of Shun, and knicked one of them when I hit a bone. This 12" Slicing knife is long enough to take on a whole brisket, or any part of a full turkey. Its sharper than I thought it was going to be too. Its a win/win and my "goto" BBQ knife going forward. Easy to clean too. If you dont have one, add this to your cart ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Damazon Prime

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding slicer at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a nice slicer for when i dont have easy access to my electric knife. Could not be more pleased with how this knife performs. After slicing two large prime rib roasts, it was easy to tell that this was a winner. Only thing I have any concern about is how hard its going to be to sharpen. Personally, I try to hand sharpen all my kitchen knifes with up to 2k grit stones. To provide a baseline of my knives they composed almost entirely of je henkle 4 star. Great knives with super hard solingen steel blades. This knife is holding its own along side them at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B Keen

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for fine cuts of lunch meat, I also use this to take the skin off salmon. The Granton blade is more expensive but definitely worth the money. Really makes slicing feel effortless and the blunt tip prevents stabbing the meat. The handle is very industrial and clean with a rough all around​ texture like powder coating matte. Used and tested in meat market
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Knife For Slicing Slow-Smoked Meat...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I'm just getting into the slow-smoked BBQ brisket game and was told I should get my hands on a Victorinox 12" Slicer. And they were right! This knife slices through meat like butter and has no problem making the 1/4" slices I want. I can't recommend this knife enough. I also can't wait to see how it does on this year's Thanksgiving turkey.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm_527

customer_reviews.title: Solid knife for brisket, tritip & more
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this knife based on the reviews and really, who has not heard of Victorinox Swiss Amry? My first impression was the knife is much longer then I visioned. The grip is textured and comfortable to hold while carving. I used this to slice a smoked tritip and tested cutting at several thickness levels. It cut with ease and is now my goto blade for cutting up meat.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Krappenschitz

customer_reviews.title: The best kitchen knives
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, like all Victorinox knives. I've converted my entire set of kitchen knives to Victorinox (except the paring knives). Victorinox knives have the best handles of any knife I've ever used -- they never become slippery unlike the much more expensive Henkels Zwilling knives. The knives are stamped, not forged, but they are very, very sharp. To maintain the sharpness get one of the inexpensive manual knife sharpeners, such as Chefs Choice Diamond Hone 463 Asian.
customer_reviews.author: PeterB37

customer_reviews.title: Fibrox Pro Slicing Knife is a must have for Brisket Smokers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fibrox Pro Slicing Knife with 12" Granton Blade. I used it twice for Smoked Brisket. it is very sharp and makes clean thin slices. I am very pleased with the purchase! I recommend purchasing a blade guard to keep it sharp and protect yourself from cuts.
customer_reviews.author: T. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research on slicing knives and decided on this one. Very glad I did. I think it’s a terrific value. The handle is comfortable, the blade slices through brisket, turkey and rib roast like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Tumbleweed

customer_reviews.title: Practical and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use when preparing smoked BBQ ribs and briskets. The knife is of good quality, very sharp and cuts both meats cleanly every time. Our son who uses this same knife for his BBQ business, recommended this purchase and he was correct. I really like the rounded nose as opposed to the long chef knives that I own which have sharp pointed ends.
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but where is the sheath?
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to give this product 5 star as it is well built, came sharp, works! But, this is not the kind of knife that is going to fit into your knife block (even if you had room)... really thought it would have come with a sheath or cheap blade protector of some kind! Even after the fact, searched the Victorinox website for a protector of some kind... did not find. Will look for something generic, but you don't want to leave this thing laying loose in a drawer!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: The grip is the best I've ever felt--very steady and secure with no slip
customer_reviews.text: This costs twice as much as I've ever spent on a slicer, but I've found it worth it. The grip is the best I've ever felt--very steady and secure with no slip. The cheaper slicers I've used in the past had a narrower blade, but this broader blade really does a superior job. This is a very easy knife to use, and it slices almost through thought alone.
customer_reviews.author: Doak Procter

customer_reviews.title: These knives have been reviewed on ATK several times and ...
customer_reviews.text: These knives have been reviewed on ATK several times and quite frankly, they are well worth it. This particular knife, as a slicer, is light, thin blade, a non-slip handle, and inexpensive as knives of this caliber go. It is as very sharp and yes, it can be re-sharpened if you accidently cut into bone while carving your holiday prime rib roast! After all, from the company who invented the Swedish Army knife, wouldn't you expect this knife to live up to that kind of pedigree?
customer_reviews.author: Gunther

customer_reviews.title: Ron Swanson would buy this knife
customer_reviews.text: If you're serious about meat and looking for a solid carving knife, this is for you. Some people buy the serrated mechanical knives that tear through the meat... not to mention you look like a nerd using knife that requires a plug in the wall. The thinness of the blade enables you to SLICE super thin pieces of meat. It produces a better end product while leaving the crowd to think you're naturally skilled in the art of meat. The blade stays sharp and it comes from a very credible company. I liked it so much that I bought my dad one for Father's Day... to replace his lame mechanical one.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Slicer at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This arrived a week or so ago, and the first thing I sliced with it was a bacon wrapped meatloaf. I was able to cut 1/8" slices with ease and each slice was still wrapped in the super thing strip of bacon. Cuts easily with very little drag. I can't wait to slice up a brisket with it. Also, just like my Victorinox filet knife, the handle has a super texture that makes it easy to grip even with wet or greasy hands.
customer_reviews.author: TravisNTexas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect brisket slicer!
customer_reviews.text: Nice slicer! Cuts a brisket in half with little to no effort. I can slice a brisket into proper slices quickly. Makes separating the point from the flat really easy. Really sharp out of the box. I do wish it came with an edge protector, but that's a cheap and easy purchase. It's a long knife, it might not fit into a lot of kitchen drawers, which isn't a big deal for me- this is going on a magnetic rack.
customer_reviews.author: dagnabbit

customer_reviews.title: Very big but great knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife is very lightweight and easy to use. It's quite long, so you won't have any trouble slicing larger meats, like turkeys. It is very sharp. I wouldn't mind having a smaller version of the same knife. Not sure if they make one. So far I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Girl

customer_reviews.title: The best carving knife.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best carving knife that we have ever had. We used it immediately after receiving it to effortlessly carve a turkey breast and a prime rib roast.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as sharp as I expected.....
customer_reviews.text: The knife is fine in all ways except one important one...It arrived unsharp. I will have to put an edge on it, but I expected it to arrive razor-sharp. I previously purchased a Victorinox boning knife and it was "fiendishly sharp" on arrival. Not this one though.
customer_reviews.author: Neurad1

customer_reviews.title: May or may not be sharp.
customer_reviews.text: The knife I received was not sharp at all. By that, I mean it wasn't sharp enough to cut through our fully-cooked Thanksgiving turkey without a struggle. Tried it again on Prime Rib, and couldn't cut all the way through without a lot of downward force - then tried with a regular steak knife and it was effortless. I'll sharpen it myself (once I figure how to do that), and it will probably be fine after that -- but, still disappointed that it didn't arrive sharpened like everyone else's knife apparently did.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to ANY kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent knife! Litterally razor sharp. This wonderful addition to my kitchen knives, slices like the proverbial "hot knife through butter"! As an exercise, I sliced a ripe tomato into slices so thin that you could read newsprint through them. If you want a remarkably sharp knife for slicing, buy thus one!
customer_reviews.author: Aria

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for brisket
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for slicing brisket. It works perfectly and is plenty sharp to power through a thick bark. If I had a need, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Berfield

customer_reviews.title: Amazon carved out a great Thanksgiving turkey !
customer_reviews.text: Saw this knife rated as top carver on Cook's Country- found it on Amazon and had it before Thansgiving !! It is SHARP ! Carved beautifully -length can carve a large roast or turkey with ease.Handle is very comfortable for men or women. The balanced weight of this knife is perfect !! Did not come with case so care is needed to store safely. Price was better than kitchen stores in my area who carried it .
customer_reviews.author: lisbeth R.

customer_reviews.title: 5 star & highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: You can pay 20 times the price for a similar knife that will not come close to how good this is. This is the best slicing knife made (Their chefs knife is all great) Its a very comfortable handle that works perfectly. For this price its unbeatable. As soon as you try this knife you just know its perfect, nothing better.
customer_reviews.author: T. McKay

customer_reviews.title: WOW!! Quite a knife!
customer_reviews.text: Super, Super Sharp!! Perfect for cutting a large roast into steaks. I bought a 13lb Prime Rib Roast and cut it into 17, 1" ribeye steaks and 1 1/2 pound ground steak hamburgers. This savings was more than the cost of this knife and was needed to cut such a large piece of meat. Cuts were even and smooth. It sliced through the meat very easily. This knife has already paid for itself! Amazon's part in this review was easy, quick shipping and excellent packaging. Couldn't be more pleased...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Father-in-Law used it to cut the ham and said he really liked it. He's cut a few hams in his ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim just before a family get-together. My Father-in-Law used it to cut the ham and said he really liked it. He's cut a few hams in his day. While it make look serrated at first glace it's not, so it can easily be sharpened. The pockets in the side help it slide better through whatever you're cutting, reducing friction.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: My RIB cutting knife
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this knife, I do BBQ contests and this is my go to for ribs that I need to put in the box or present to judges, of course there are more expensive knifes but for the price of this one I'll stick with Victornix; just be careful when you wash it because its super sharp, I always say this knife does the cutting I don't, never have to push the blade, just move from side to side slowly...
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Mora

customer_reviews.title: Slices through tough meat like butter.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp. Slices through pastrami, brisket, pork shoulder and flank steak like butter. Makes perfect slices much easier than even high quality Global brand chef knives. I love using it to trim fat caps and other traditionally hard to cut meats.
customer_reviews.author: Adam A.

customer_reviews.title: Its my Excalibur to cutting Tri Tip.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and makes cutting tri tip seem like you are cutting through butter. If you want thin slices when cutting a large board of meat this knife will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Waller

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, very sharp and  well made.
customer_reviews.text: This knife does a great job of slicing large pieces of meats. The slice control is amazing. I'm glad I added it to my collection. For storage, I place it in an edge guard as the knife is too long for my knife block. I recommend this knife to anybody who likes to serve nice slices instead of shredded pieces of meat.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara O

customer_reviews.title: Perfect knife for carving
customer_reviews.text: Craves meat like warm butter. It's easy to grip and highly recommend if you carve. I use this knife over my meat slicer
customer_reviews.author: TOMMY Y LEE

customer_reviews.title: This Kinife Will Cut Your Prime Rib Easily !
customer_reviews.text: This knife is way better than a high end electric knife. Victorinox knives are one the best for the food service industry. Cut slices of prime rib to whatever thickness you want with easy strokes.
customer_reviews.author: Windward K

customer_reviews.title: After I removed the turkey meat from the carcass, ...
customer_reviews.text: After I removed the turkey meat from the carcass, slicing the meat was efficient and quick. Also slicing ham was expedited with the long blade after some practice making a full slice in lieu of "sawing". Anxious to share this tool at holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great slicing blade for the money. I was already a Victornox fan before before buying this knife and it is my go to slicer (over a much more expensive set that we have) for general use when we don't have company around. The edge holds for a good period of time between sharpenings and when it is fresh off the sharpener the blade moves clean and the handle material is very easy to clean. Excellent utility slicer and is a frequent go-to in our house for Tri Tip and bigger cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Lindemann

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with Victorinox
customer_reviews.text: I own a number of Wusthof knives. They can't hold a candle to the sharpness of Victorinox. Used these when I worked in restaurants. Even if it's damaged, it doesn't cost an arm and a leg to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Spak

customer_reviews.title: A-mazing!
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome! I don't know what else to say besides it's very high quality and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Best slicer I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife for slicing meats after cooking in one on my BBQ pits. The non slip grip handle works as advertised. The uniform thickness of slices is easy to accomplish with this knife. The knife holds the edge longer than expected and sharpens easily. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: OGauge4Me

customer_reviews.title: It is a wonderful, large knife
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this knife just before Thanksgiving, after researching reviews (from Cooks Country, for one specific place). It is a wonderful, large knife, which did the trick with turkey, and will do so for many other slicings. Separately, from another source, and to protect the blade while being stored in my kitchen, I purchased a slider to slip over the blade. I highly recommend purchasing a slider thingy to protect the blade of every knife you own and treasure. A great knife!
customer_reviews.author: Life is Delicious!

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: Excellent knife for briskets. Purchased solely to cut briskets and flank steaks. Works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: mrs lee

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for carving tri tip,  roast beef or ham.
customer_reviews.text: I never new why servers at carving stations always used these style of knives - UNTIL I used this one. What a great, easy way to cut uniform thicknesses of beef and ham. Keep it sharp and it's always​ like cutting through butter.
customer_reviews.author: sunfun

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for carving a boneless prime rib and any ...
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for carving a boneless prime rib and any boneless roast. The straight blade which is not very flexible for intricate type carving (around bones) this knife is best used for straight style carving. Otherwise, the knife is good quality and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing slicer, Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: Solid design, quality materials, ergonomic handle feels great in your hand. Slices anything like butter. Amazing slicer, Great Value.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife (very big)...Outstanding purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, price, shipping. highly recommended. I didn't quite realize how large this knife is (really shape too). You'll need plenty of room to do the slicing. I wish I could find a sheath for the blade. I recommend opening the package on the edge near the handle (along the seem) and use the packaging to protect the knife (and anyone handling items close to the knife....VERY SHARP!!!). Very happy with purchase (ordered two). Another GREAT advantage of purchasing from Amazon is they sent the knifes to two separate locations...all that shipping was free (PRIME) and arrived on-time (early in one case). Thank you for fine service!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer
customer_reviews.text: Great slicing knife. I BBQ multiple times per week. This is my go to slicer for brisket, turkey breast, and other large cuts. I will be purchasing the shorter version soon. This is s loooong knife. Make sure you have the room to store it
customer_reviews.author: Aprice2280

customer_reviews.title: great knife
customer_reviews.text: amazing knife, slices thru roasts, turkey ham with ease. I like the longer length; being a shorter person it is always great to have a knife that makes it easier to reach and cut. The Swiss made knife is of exceptional quality.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Jones

customer_reviews.title: doesnt work like I thought
customer_reviews.text: I bought my last serrated knife 25 years ago, still works, and I have used on everything and still cuts a tomato or soft bread.... but this one after a couple of months, isn't as good as when I bought.
customer_reviews.author: newshower

customer_reviews.title: Great knives
customer_reviews.text: Love victorinox blades.. Slices nicely and feels professional. A sharp knife is a good knife, and this is a perfect fit
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Best Knife I Own!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this knife 8 years ago. Only use it a few times a year to slice jerky, brisket and other large cuts of meat. I kept the plastic clamshell packaging to store it in. I have never had to hone or sharpen it and it’s still razor sharp. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Branon

customer_reviews.title: This REALLY is a great knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife! I'm an amateur cook, now graduating to doing lunches and dinners for up to 300 people, so my knives do not sit idle in the drawer. This is a terrific slicing knife-almost effortless--if you use the same pressure in slicing that you have been with other knives, you'll probably bounce the meat right off the board onto the floor--I'm serious. No shredding, no tearing, no slices sticking to the knife blade. Probably the closest thing to a professional deli slicer there is (but unfortunately not as "automatic"). I have been very satisfied with all Victorinox knives I have purchased--this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: J. Frazee

customer_reviews.title: It's a great blade and very sharp out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is the knife you see at Brazilian restaurants where the staff says repeatedly "whatever you do, do not let your fingers get in the way as we slice the meat because the blade is sharp". It's a great blade and very sharp out of the box. We use it for slicing turkey, ham, etc, and it is very effective. Honestly can't provide any information about sharpening though since I'm not allowed to sharpen it. That's Doug's bailiwick.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Slices things easily
customer_reviews.text: The first impression I got after unpacking this thing was, "Geez, it's huge." Turns out the size helps you gain leverage to really cut through whatever it is you're slicing. It cut through my roasted pork easily, and I'm looking forward to using it on the turkey when Thanksgiving rolls around again.
customer_reviews.author: klwong36

customer_reviews.title: Limited Usefulness
customer_reviews.text: It does have less drag but the shape and thinness of the blade makes is not very useful. For example, it is fine for turkey breast but not for chicken breast because the blade is just too wide and awkward for cutting something as small as a roasted chicken. Same for a leg of lamb. I wish I would had returned it but my return window closed just two weeks ago. I only used it twice since I bought it and probably will not use it again because it does not give that much of an advantage over a standard slicing knife.
customer_reviews.author: John of Maine

customer_reviews.title: Another great Victorinox knife!
customer_reviews.text: I have never been disappointed by a Victorinox knife. I own about eight of them. Great knives. They hold an edge. They are comfortable in my hand. The hilts are made of a material that grips even when wet or messy. They are not the most expensive knives that I own but they are the best knives that I own. This one cut roast beef in thin even slices just like it was butter.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Vitorinox 12-inch Granton Edge Slicing Knife
customer_reviews.text: Bought this knife for daughter's fiancé. He was elated! The knife, as demonstrated by the guy, is extremely sharp. It comes with a cover, which should be placed over the knife before it is placed in a drawer (daughter reached into drawer to get another item, brushed against knife (without the case) and sliced a little piece of skin off her finger! It is, I repeat, a very sharp knife. High quality. I would recommend it to friends or relatives.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hays

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife for Sliding Brisket and Ribs.
customer_reviews.text: I saw the other good reviews of this knife and purchased one. It does not disappoint. No more flaking my rub off of briskets when I go to cut them. Would definitely buy this knife again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hannifin

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT for slicing brisket (and everything else I have tried it on so far). Remains razor-sharp, no signs of dulling. Very good quality (blade and handle) ... I always hand wash.
customer_reviews.author: J. MILLER

customer_reviews.title: GREATEST KNIFE EVER!
customer_reviews.text: We bought for our brisket and boy let me tell you, this is the greatest knife ever! Slices through like butter!!!! Doesn't crush the meat. Any serious bbq'er needs one!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent slicer!
customer_reviews.text: Great slicer. Sharp, easy handling knife. It's got just enough flex to make it easy to use, but is stiff enough to make nice straight cuts with it. Fibrox handle is great in all conditions. I've used it for everything from bread to brisket, and it's held up well. Long enough for most big cuts of meat, but not too long to be unwieldy. Thin blade keeps it light.
customer_reviews.author: Genthar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for briskets!
customer_reviews.text: I love the width of the blade and it’s balanced feel. I use the meat smoker frequently; I’m looking forward to using it on my next brisket!
customer_reviews.author: C. Black

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic addition to my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: For years I just used a chef's knife to slice meats, and would have difficulting slicing evenly and easily unless I was vigilant to keep it very very sharp. I used this knife for the first time last night to slice a cooked steak (flank), and it was a dramatic difference. Thinner, more even slices, I can't believe I didn't have one of these years ago. If I could only have 4 knives, it would be one of them (chef, pairing, bread/serrated, and slicing). Again, I love my chef's knife, but I cannot exaggerate how much I love this slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, very sharp and easy to slice with when used with a quality carving fork, no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Mehgan Keil

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife is great for carving. I was extremely impressed at the straight, clean, thin slices I was able to produce on a side of beef. The granton edge was nice as well too. The knife is huge. Which is great for slicing larger sides of beef or a large turkey, but its overkill when it comes to slicing smaller things like thicken or smaller sides of beef. So if you want to slice large items, this is your item. But if you are looking to slice smaller items, a 12-inch blade is probably a little too much for your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: It is EXACTLY as advertized
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes! Slices like a dream. Well balanced. Seems to be holding it's edge just fine. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another or any knife by this MFG!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Slices So Well
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these knives. But be forewarned, face them down in the drawer because they will slice you like a tomato without even knowing what happened. It happened to me and a friend who was looking for a knife in my drawer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Swan

customer_reviews.title: The BBQ Slicer You Need
customer_reviews.text: Terrific knife for slicing brisket and other meats. It's sharp, very comfortable to use, and dishwasher safe too. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: buy it
customer_reviews.text: Brought this knife to cut brisket and ribs it has made cutting large meats easy
customer_reviews.author: Sound Master

customer_reviews.title: Every slice is so nice!
customer_reviews.text: I've recently began making all of my own food and this included roasting meats with the intention of using them for sandwiches thus passing on all the salty sandwich meats sold in the store. I have roasted pork loin, beef roasts, chickens, and turkey breasts for this purpose and each time I made a mess out of the meat when trying to slice it thinly enough for what I wanted. I wasn't looking for paper thin, maybe for 1/4 of an inch or so. Since receiving this knife, i can slice as thin as i like.
customer_reviews.author: Dena2U

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts smoothly and straight! Used this carver last night to carve a brisket. If I wanted to I could have cut 1/8" slices or thinner!
customer_reviews.author: TomC

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced, perfect weight and sliced perfectly j
customer_reviews.text: Typical Victorinox excellence. Although a one task tool, it is just reliable as all my other V-nox cooking cutlery. Miles ahead of my other non V-nox professional and impeccably maintained knives. Great slicing, perfectly balanced and sharpens and hones beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Randeroo

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife is awesome, wish I bought it a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Brisket cut like butter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut a tender smoked brisket, and it is the tool I wish I had purchased sooner. Smooth cuts and no tearing of the meat. Only thing that would make it better is if it came with a sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Feels like you're not even holding a knife. Super ergonomic and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Alan Wooldridge

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect item description
customer_reviews.text: Well I wish I knew if this thing worked or not however they continually shipped me the wrong knife. Asking for a 12” slicing knife and they keep sending me the 8” chefs knife
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Luxury knife
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this knife for slicing prime rib. It is sharp and slices through meat quite easily. The 12" blade is long enough that I don't have to 'saw' through meat, as I had to with a shorter knife.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife from a great seller!
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp knife. You can’t and won’t go wrong with this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Rubicon Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good Slicer
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this knife for slicing Bisquick, ribs etc. Nice ergonomics, but could have been a bit sharper out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddy050970

customer_reviews.title: amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I need to cut thin slices beef or chicken, don't want to store & clean a big electric slicer and I don't see there's a decent electric knife, finally I found this amazing knife! I see it has very good comment, actually don't quite believe it at first, watched some youtube video how it works, ordered one, just tried it today, amazing! cuts perfect! unbelievable! the only tiny problem is that i don't need a 12-inch knife, 10-inch will suits me better.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: A little to big for me .. hence the 4 stars.. but cut the prime rib and turkey beautifully
customer_reviews.author: susan laperriere

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically for slicing a Serrano style ham. Did a great job. Was able to get paper thin slices. Then moved on to a rib roast and it did an excellent job there a well. The long length makes slicing larger cuts of meat smooth and easy and with a little practice one fell swoop. Arrived sharp and so far has stayed sharp. It's a great addition to the kitchen and I look forward to using it more.
customer_reviews.author: mhammo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tri tip
customer_reviews.text: Great knife! Works on all meats but we especially love how it cuts tri tip. Super thin slices that could be ready for a sandwich.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: unbelievable knife at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I just used this slicing knife on rib roast at Christmas. I couldn't believe how easy it was to slice the roast. This knife is really sharp. My dad was a butcher and this knife is even better than his butcher knives. This carver is as sharp as any expensive knife that sells for over $200. The handle is made of a material that prevents your hand from slipping which is really nice. I purchased this knife upon Cooks Illustrated recommended and they were right.
customer_reviews.author: Babs54

customer_reviews.title: It was a gift...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother-in-law for Christmas. He has nothing but great words and loves the quality and the slicing ability.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Loving

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts my tri-tip and brisket like butter. Do not forgot to get a sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: Glen C

customer_reviews.title: Poorly packaged
customer_reviews.text: If paying a decent price for a quality knife. I expected it to come in at least a box, not a plastic sleeve. The knife itself is sharp and weighted nicely. packaging is something else. I hope I got what I paid for?
customer_reviews.author: George P.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through meat smoothly and quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is great knife. I used it to slide ham and beef on Easter Sunday, and cut the meat smoothly and quickly. It was packed well for shipping and arrived quickly. This was a good choice for me, and I think it would be for you also if you want a knife that makes your work easier. I highly recommend this knife.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heeren

customer_reviews.title: This is One Mean Knife!
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp, imposing size, sturdy. Cuts through a roast like it was nothing!
customer_reviews.author: Bill O'Meally

customer_reviews.title: So good, the turkey said thanks
customer_reviews.text: The blade is sharp and keeps an edge. The knife is very long so it makes quick work of whole birds or whole cooked squash. I have used this knife for two years. I cut the breast whole off the turkey, lay it on its side and then slice it. The presentation on the plate is spectacular. The knife sharpens easily and cleans up rapidly. It out performs all my pricey knives. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Buy one
customer_reviews.text: Been using one of these for a year on smoked briskets, ribs, roasted birds, flank steaks, etc. Great performing knife. Wish I'd bought one years ago, and have since bought them as gifts for others who like to smoke and grill.
customer_reviews.author: KFBlss

product_meta.title: Victorinox Swiss Army - 47645 Cutlery Fibrox Pro Slicing Knife, Granton Blade, Black, 12-Inch
product_meta.description:
Style Name:12-Inch Granton| Design:KnifeA TRUSTED FAVORITE
Preferred by both home chefs and culinary professionals, the 12" Victorinox Fibrox Pro Slicing Knife can handle nearly every kitchen task imaginable. Crafted with a comfortable handle, superior weight and balance, and a razor sharp Granton Blade that rarely requires re-sharpening, this knife is an essential tool for every kitchen.

KEY FEATURES


 *  High-quality, lightweight European steel.
 *  Handle design reduces hand and wrist fatigue.
 *  Fit for slicing both firm and soft meats. 
 *  Long, straight blade for maximized cutting performance.
 *  Granton Blade to minimize friction and prevent food from sticking.
 *  Non-slip patented Fibrox Pro handle for a secure and comfortable grip no matter the hand size. 
 *  National Sanitary Foundation (NSF) approved and dishwasher safe. 


CARE AND USE
Be good to your knives and they’ll be good to you. Following these simple guidelines will ensure that you get the longest life out of your knife! 

CLEANING
Victorinox Swiss Army recommends washing all knives by hand. For best results, hand wash your knives with a soapy cloth and dry immediately. 
While Fibrox Pro knives are dishwasher safe, we recommend hand washing as dishwashers are designed to spray water at a relatively high pressure, which can jostle the silverware and cause the knives to collide, dulling the edge.

SHARPENING
For optimum performance, knives should be honed after every couple of uses. Proper and frequent use of a honing steel will keep your knives sharper and performing at their best. 

FORMERLY FORSCHNER
In 1937 Victorinox began selling cutlery in America through a Connecticut distributor called R.H. Forschner & Co. A well-known manufacturer of butcher scales, Forschner soon became the exclusive U.S. distributor for Victorinox knives, and was the name by which Victorinox knives were known.
feature_bullets: ESSENTIAL CARVING KNIFE. A versatile kitchen essential for slicing and carving meats. Crafted with a round tip and Granton Blade, this knife creates air pockets to minimize friction and improve meat separation.

SLICE WITH PRECISION. With a long, narrow shape and razor sharp edge, this knife can slice through meats in a single, smooth motion. The high-carbon stainless steel blade makes smaller and thinner slices easier and more uniform.
EASY HANDLING. This knife features an ergonomic Fibrox Pro handle for a non-slip grip -- even when wet. This exceptional knife is weighted and balanced for easy handling.

KNIFE DIMENSIONS. Stainless steel blade -- 12" in length. Meets the strict National Sanitation Foundation (NSF) standards for public health protection. 12 inch blade with a 5.4 inch handle creating a total of 17.4 long

TRUSTED SWISS QUALITY. Expertly crafted in Switzerland in 1884, Victorinox provides a lifetime guarantee against defects in material and workmanship. Making a lifetime commitment has never been so easy.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
